meanings.definition: A medieval land tenure in which property is held in return for payment of a fixed sum of money or services.
meanings.sent1: In medieval times, a burgage was a way to own land by paying money or doing tasks.
meanings.sent2: The burgage system allowed people to have land by either paying money or providing services.
meanings.sent3: Imagine if we still used burgages today to buy houses - paying with chores instead of money!
meanings.sent4: The concept of a burgage is like a subscription service for land ownership.
meanings.sent5: The idea of a burgage is like having a membership to own a piece of land.

meanings.definition: A plot of land held under the feudal system.
meanings.sent1: The small burgage was part of the larger feudal estate.
meanings.sent2: In the feudal system, a burgage was a specific piece of land granted to someone.
meanings.sent3: The burgage in the feudal system was like a tiny kingdom within a kingdom.
meanings.sent4: Owning a burgage meant having a small piece of the feudal puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The burgage was like a miniature realm within the larger feudal domain.
